FAQs.header: How do I apply for a Stella Card?
text: Sign up for a Stella Pay App account and complete our KYC verification.
Apply for your preferred card type.Support physical card and virtual card.
Deposit your cryptocurrencies and exchange the cryptocurrencies to top up the card.

FAQs.header: Is the Stella Visa Card a credit or debit card?
text: The Stella Visa Card is a prepaid card. Broadly speaking, prepaid cards are the same as debit cards. The difference is that debit cards are linked to your bank account, but prepaid cards need to be topped up. In our case, you can top up using cryptocurrency.
Stella Card is accepted anywhere Visa® debit cards are accepted, at over 40M+ merchants worldwide.
You can top up your card using your preferred Crypto in the Stella Pay App.
Information about fees and limits (i.e. free ATM withdrawals, interbank exchange rates, top-ups, etc.) can be found in the StellaPay App.
Currently, we support the conversion and spending of USDC, USDT, BTC, ETH with your Stella Card, and will support more in the future.

FAQs.header: What happens if my payment gets refunded?
text: The Stella Card is denominated in base currency, the base currency is determined when you apply for the card, and all related transactions are processed in base currency. Therefore, refunds of any kind will always be credited in base currency. Currently the base currency supported by our card is USD. In the future, our card will support base currency denomination of more types of currencies.
